Pre-Game Insights: Benin will enter Tuesday’s match hoping to restart their pursuit of a spot in Morocco after finishing in the quarterfinals in Egypt back in 2019.
On the other side, Rwanda held Libya to a 1-1 draw in Tripoli’s 11 June Stadium on Wednesday, denying them a dream start to their AFCON qualifying campaign.

Libya last participated in the continental championship back in 2012, when they were eliminated in the group stages after earning four points from three games—one victory, one tie—and placing third in Group A.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Benin lost 3-0 to the Super Eagles at the Godswill Akpabio Stadium on Saturday as they were outmatched and outplayed by their opponents from West Africa, Nigeria, in their Group D opening.
